text:
They bound Dostoevsky and twenty others to stakes. 

“We’re to be shot,” he thought. 

He kissed his friends, Plestcheiev and Dourov. 

“Farewell,” he whispered. 

Suddenly, the troops beat a tattoo. 

They unbound them. 

“His Majesty has spared your lives,” came the announcement. 

Grigoryev went mad as they released him. 

Dostoevsky felt the weight of their suffering. 

Four years of penal servitude followed. 

He wrote of agony and cruelty. 

His mind bore the scars of that day.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Dostoevsky's near-execution and subsequent imprisonment profoundly influenced his writing and views on suffering and cruelty.
